div.div: Created new branch feat-group in HalfSweet/doxybook

fw/boards/obelix: Selecting a low-speed clock source with a macro
Signed-off-by: haoranjiang<halfsweet@halfsweet.cn>

fw/apps/prf/mfg_menu: add new app to render device name as a QR
When clicking the first menu entry, a device name QR will be rendered. This is useful in manufacturing environments.
Signed-off-by: Gerard Marull-Paretas <gerard@teslabs.com>

resources: drop asterix PRF QR image
It is now rendered.
Signed-off-by: Gerard Marull-Paretas <gerard@teslabs.com>

fw/apps/prf/recovery_first_use: use rendered QR code on asterix
Also ifdefout some unused resources/call paths.
Signed-off-by: Gerard Marull-Paretas <gerard@teslabs.com>

fw/applib/ui: add QRCode
Add a new API to render QR codes. Note that the implementation is not really optimal in terms of allocated memory when rendering. LVGL, for example, added some extra APIs to the underlying QR library to pre-compute the minimal version given data size, thus minimizing allocated memory. This can be improved later without changing the API though.
Regarding app_malloc.json entry: I have no clue on how that is supposed to work, so I just guessed values also with the "help" of static asserts.
Signed-off-by: Gerard Marull-Paretas <gerard@teslabs.com>

third_party: add QR-Code-generator library
So we can render QR codes.
Signed-off-by: Gerard Marull-Paretas <gerard@teslabs.com>

fw: add Memfault SDK
## Summary
Add the Memfault SDK as a git submodule, and integrate it into the project.
This enables tracking the following in Memfault:
- reboots (translated pebble reboot reason codes) - heartbeat metrics
Some console commands are included to help test the integration:
- `mflt export` : dump serialized Memfault chunks - `mflt heartbeat` : trigger a heartbeat - `mflt metrics_dump` : print current heartbeat values - `mflt device_info` : print device serial, software type, hardware version
Memfault is enabled by default for `asterix` + `obelix`. Provide a configure options, `--memfault {0,1}` to override the default.
TODO:
- log capture - Memfault coredumps
## Testing
Flashed to an asterix board, and ran these test commands:
```bash mflt heartbeat mflt export ```
Uploaded the symbol file (`build/src/fw/tintin_fw.elf`) and chunks to `app.memfault.com` and confirmed both processed correctly.
Note: reboot reason tracking is not implemented on the nRF5 platform (see `reboot_reason.c`). We'll need a solution there, eg just a small slice of .noinit ram ideally.
---
Signed-off-by: Noah Pendleton <noah@memfault.com>

wscript: default log level to debug
Logs will be more helpful now that we're testing firmware on multiple devices and observing issues. This can be reverted once things stabilize.
Signed-off-by: Gerard Marull-Paretas <gerard@teslabs.com>

fw/apps/prf/recovery_first_use: do not change pairability on mobile event
A mobile event may not signify a BLE disconnection, so pairability, discoverability cannot be adjusted if disconnection doesn't happen first. A true disconnection will happen later if PPoGATT fails to keep connection alive, and so such settings change will be handled by then.
Signed-off-by: Gerard Marull-Paretas <gerard@teslabs.com>

fw/comm/ble: do not disconnect if not encrypted on intent unregister
When a re-pair event happens, connection must not be dropped when an intent is unregistered, otherwise the process will fail. Handle this case by checking if connection is encrypted at this point.
Signed-off-by: Gerard Marull-Paretas <gerard@teslabs.com>

fw/comm/ble: add gap_le_connection_is_encrypted
Signed-off-by: Gerard Marull-Paretas <gerard@teslabs.com>

fw/comm/ble: remove redundant noisy advert log
Signed-off-by: Gerard Marull-Paretas <gerard@teslabs.com>

fw/ble: report initial MTU when connection occurs
Signed-off-by: Gerard Marull-Paretas <gerard@teslabs.com>

fw/comm/ble: set MTU change log level to INFO
Signed-off-by: Gerard Marull-Paretas <gerard@teslabs.com>

fw/comm/ble: improve encryption change log messages
Signed-off-by: Gerard Marull-Paretas <gerard@teslabs.com>

bluetooth-fw/nimble/pps: only log notification errors
Signed-off-by: Gerard Marull-Paretas <gerard@teslabs.com>

bluetooth-fw/nimble: handle/log NOTIFY_TX
Signed-off-by: Gerard Marull-Paretas <gerard@teslabs.com>

fw: bluetooth logging cleanup
Remove unused log levels, just use BT (on) and BT_STACK (off).
Signed-off-by: Gerard Marull-Paretas <gerard@teslabs.com>

bluetooth-fw/nimble: only notify about completed pairing if needed
NimBLE stack reports the BLE_GAP_EVENT_PAIRING_COMPLETE in every connection after a pairing is done, not just after a successful BLE_GAP_EVENT_PASSKEY_ACTION. This means we are sending unnecessary events if pairing was performed before.
Signed-off-by: Gerard Marull-Paretas <gerard@teslabs.com>

fw/drivers/sf32lb52: fix the UART driver in SF32LB52
Signed-off-by: haoranjiang <halfsweet@halfsweet.cn> Signed-off-by: xiaomingxi <xiaomingxi@sifli.com>

src/libutil/includes/util/misc.h: Add container_of macro
Signed-off-by: haoranjiang <halfsweet@halfsweet.cn>
Opened #113 fw/boards/obelix:Selecting a low-speed clock source with a macro
Created new branch LXT in HalfSweet/pebbleos
